articles.title: Inside a Dark Adtech Empire Fed by Fake CAPTCHAs
articles.summary: Late last year, security researchers made a startling discovery: Kremlin-backed disinformation campaigns were bypassing moderation on social media platforms by leveraging the same malicious advertising technology that powers a sprawling ecosystem of online hucksters and website hackers. A new report on the fallout from that investigation finds this dark ad tech industry is far more resilient and incestuous than previously known.
articles.technical_analysis: Technical analysis in progress. Enhanced security posture and monitoring recommended.

articles.title: Patch Tuesday, June 2025 Edition
articles.summary: Microsoft today released security updates to fix at least 67 vulnerabilities in its Windows operating systems and software. Redmond warns that one of the flaws is already under active attack, and that software blueprints showing how to exploit a pervasive Windows bug patched this month are now public.

articles.title: U.S. Sanctions Cloud Provider ‘Funnull’ as Top Source of ‘Pig Butchering’ Scams
articles.summary: The U.S. government today imposed economic sanctions on Funnull Technology Inc., a Philippines-based company that provides computer infrastructure for hundreds of thousands of websites involved in virtual currency investment scams, commonly known as “pig butchering." In January 2025, KrebsOnSecurity detailed how Funnull was being used as a content delivery network that catered to cybercriminals seeking to route their traffic through U.S.-based cloud providers.

articles.title: Pakistan Arrests 21 in ‘Heartsender’ Malware Service
articles.summary: Authorities in Pakistan have arrested 21 individuals accused of operating "Heartsender," a once popular spam and malware dissemination service that operated for more than a decade. The main clientele for HeartSender were organized crime groups that tried to trick victim companies into making payments to a third party, and its alleged proprietors were publicly identified by KrebsOnSecurity in 2021 after they inadvertently infected their computers with malware.

articles.title: Oops: DanaBot Malware Devs Infected Their Own PCs
articles.summary: The U.S. government today unsealed criminal charges against 16 individuals accused of operating and selling DanaBot, a prolific strain of information-stealing malware that has been sold on Russian cybercrime forums since 2018. The FBI says a newer version of DanaBot was used for espionage, and that many of the defendants exposed their real-life identities after accidentally infecting their own systems with the malware.

articles.title: KrebsOnSecurity Hit With Near-Record 6.3 Tbps DDoS
articles.summary: KrebsOnSecurity last week was hit by a near record distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack that clocked in at more than 6.3 terabits of data per second (a terabit is one trillion bits of data). The brief attack appears to have been a test run for a massive new Internet of Things (IoT) botnet capable of launching crippling digital assaults that few web destinations can withstand. Read on for more about the botnet, the attack, and the apparent creator of this global menace.

articles.title: Breachforums Boss to Pay $700k in Healthcare Breach
articles.summary: In what experts are calling a novel legal outcome, the 22-year-old former administrator of the cybercrime community Breachforums will forfeit nearly $700,000 to settle a civil lawsuit from a health insurance company whose customer data was posted for sale on the forum in 2023. Conor Brian Fitzpatrick, a.k.a. "Pompompurin," is slated for resentencing next month after pleading guilty to access device fraud and possession of child sexual abuse material (CSAM).

articles.title: [Guest Diary] Anatomy of a Linux SSH Honeypot Attack: Detailed Analysis of Captured Malware, (Fri, Jun 13th)
articles.summary: &&#x23;x26;&#x23;x5b;This is a Guest Diary by Michal Ambrozkiewicz, an ISC intern as part of the SANS.edu Bachelor&&#x23;x26;&#x23;39;s Degree in Applied Cybersecurity (BACS) program &&#x23;x26;&#x23;x5b;1].]

articles.title: Quasar RAT Delivered Through Bat Files, (Wed, Jun 11th)
articles.summary: RAT&&#x23;x26;&#x23;39;s are popular malware. They are many of them in the wild, Quasar[1] being one of them. The malware has been active for a long time and new campaigns come regularly back on stage. I spotted an interesting .bat file (Windows script) that attracted my attention because it is very well obfuscated. This file is a second stage that is downloaded and launched from a simple script:

articles.title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday June 2025, (Tue, Jun 10th)
articles.summary: Microsoft today released patches for 67 vulnerabilities. 10 of these vulnerabilities are rated critical. One vulnerability has already been exploited and another vulnerability has been publicly disclosed before today.

articles.title: WestJet investigates cyberattack disrupting internal systems
articles.summary: WestJet, Canada's second-largest airline, is investigating a cyberattack that has disrupted access to some internal systems as it responds to the breach. [...]

articles.title: Anubis ransomware adds wiper to destroy files beyond recovery
articles.summary: <The Anubis ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation has added to its file-encrypting malware a wiper module that destroys targeted files, making recovery impossible even if the ransom is paid. [...]
articles.technical_analysis: Malware families detected: anubis. Enhanced security posture and monitoring recommended.

articles.title: Discord flaw lets hackers reuse expired invites in malware campaign
articles.summary: Hackers are hijacking expired or deleted Discord invite links to redirect users to malicious sites that deliver remote access trojans and information-stealing malware. [...]
articles.technical_analysis: Technical analysis in progress. Standard security protocols and awareness required.

articles.title: Victoria’s Secret restores critical systems after cyberattack
articles.summary: Victoria's Secret has restored all critical systems impacted by a May 24 security incident that forced it to shut down corporate systems and the e-commerce website. [...]

articles.title: Cloudflare: Outage not caused by security incident, data is safe
articles.summary: Cloudflare has confirmed that the massive service outage yesterday was not caused by a security incident and no data has been lost. [...]

articles.title: Trend Micro fixes critical vulnerabilities in multiple products
articles.summary: Trend Micro has released security updates to address multiple critical-severity remote code execution and authentication bypass vulnerabilities that impact its Apex Central and Endpoint Encryption (TMEE) PolicyServer products. [...]
articles.technical_analysis: Technical analysis in progress. Enhanced security posture and monitoring recommended.

articles.title: Graphite spyware used in Apple iOS zero-click attacks on journalists
articles.summary: Forensic investigation has confirmed the use of Paragon's Graphite spyware platform in zero-click attacks that targeted Apple iOS devices of at least two journalists in Europe. [...]

articles.title: Watering Hole Attacks Push ScanBox Keylogger
articles.summary: Researchers uncover a watering hole attack likely carried out by APT TA423, which attempts to plant the ScanBox JavaScript-based reconnaissance tool.
articles.technical_analysis: Malware families detected: scanbox. Enhanced security posture and monitoring recommended.

articles.title: Tentacles of ‘0ktapus’ Threat Group Victimize 130 Firms
articles.summary: Over 130 companies tangled in sprawling phishing campaign that spoofed a multi-factor authentication system.

articles.title: Ransomware Attacks are on the Rise
articles.summary: Lockbit is by far this summer’s most prolific ransomware group, trailed by two offshoots of the Conti group.
articles.technical_analysis: Malware families detected: lockbit, conti. Enhanced security posture and monitoring recommended.

articles.title: Cybercriminals Are Selling Access to Chinese Surveillance Cameras
articles.summary: Tens of thousands of cameras have failed to patch a critical, 11-month-old CVE, leaving thousands of organizations exposed.

articles.title: Twitter Whistleblower Complaint: The TL;DR Version
articles.summary: Twitter is blasted for security and privacy lapses by the company’s former head of security who alleges the social media giant’s actions amount to a national security risk.

articles.title: Firewall Bug Under Active Attack Triggers CISA Warning
articles.summary: CISA is warning that Palo Alto Networks’ PAN-OS is under active attack and needs to be patched ASAP.

articles.title: iPhone Users Urged to Update to Patch 2 Zero-Days
articles.summary: Separate fixes to macOS and iOS patch respective flaws in the kernel and WebKit that can allow threat actors to take over devices and are under attack.
articles.technical_analysis: Infrastructure elements: anonymization_network. Notable characteristics: zero-day exploitation confirmed. Immediate containment and incident response required.

articles.title: Google Patches Chrome’s Fifth Zero-Day of the Year
articles.summary: An insufficient validation input flaw, one of 11 patched in an update this week, could allow for arbitrary code execution and is under active attack.
articles.technical_analysis: Technical analysis in progress. Notable characteristics: zero-day exploitation confirmed. Immediate containment and incident response required.

articles.title: Predator spyware activity surfaces in new places with new tricks
articles.summary: The spyware’s developer, Intellexa, has been under pressure due to sanctions and public disclosure, but Recorded Future uncovered fresh activity. The post Predator spyware activity surfaces in new places with new tricks appeared first on CyberScoop.

articles.title: Paragon spyware found on the phones of Euro journos
articles.summary: They’re the first confirmed cases of Paragon spyware on Apple products, according to Citizen Lab. The post Paragon spyware found on the phones of Euro journos appeared first on CyberScoop.

articles.title: Digital rights groups sound alarm on Stop CSAM Act
articles.summary: The organizations say a reintroduced version of the bill would “break” encryption for most Americans and make it impossible for end-to-end encrypted service providers to avoid lawsuits. The post Digital rights groups sound alarm on Stop CSAM Act appeared first on CyberScoop.

articles.title: Global law enforcement action in Asia nets large infrastructure seizure, 32 arrests
articles.summary: Operation Secure targeted malicious IPs, domains and servers used for infostealer operations that claimed more than 216,000 victims. The post Global law enforcement action in Asia nets large infrastructure seizure, 32 arrests appeared first on CyberScoop.

articles.title: Dems want watchdog study of two troubled federally-funded vulnerability tracking initiatives
articles.summary: The CVE program publishes standardized information about known cyber vulnerabilities, while the NVD is a storehouse for vulnerability management data. The post Dems want watchdog study of two troubled federally-funded vulnerability tracking initiatives appeared first on CyberScoop.

articles.title: How Amazon Web Services uses AI to be a security ‘force multiplier’
articles.summary: Amazon CSO Stephen Schmidt says AI is transforming the way the company does security reviews and incident response. The post How Amazon Web Services uses AI to be a security ‘force multiplier’ appeared first on CyberScoop.

articles.title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday addresses 66 vulnerabilities, including an actively exploited zero-day
articles.summary: A researcher tells CyberScoop that up to 80% of enterprises could be vulnerable to the zero-day Microsoft patched in its June update. The post Microsoft Patch Tuesday addresses 66 vulnerabilities, including an actively exploited zero-day appeared first on CyberScoop.
articles.technical_analysis: Technical analysis in progress. Notable characteristics: zero-day exploitation confirmed. Immediate containment and incident response required.

articles.title: House Homeland Chairman Mark Green’s departure could leave congressional cyber agenda in limbo
articles.summary: Green, R-Tenn., has championed legislation on the cyber workforce, renewal of a cyber threat information sharing bill and more. The post House Homeland Chairman Mark Green’s departure could leave congressional cyber agenda in limbo appeared first on CyberScoop.

articles.title: United Natural Foods fulfilling orders on ‘limited basis’ in wake of cyberattack
articles.summary: CEO Sandy Douglas said the food distributor is helping some customers maintain inventory with assistance from other wholesalers. The post United Natural Foods fulfilling orders on ‘limited basis’ in wake of cyberattack appeared first on CyberScoop.

articles.title: House committee sets CISA budget cut at $135M, not Trump’s $495M
articles.summary: The move indicated at least some resistance to the president’s CISA reduction goal, but Democrats still said that was too steep for the agency’s fiscal 2026 funding legislation. The post House committee sets CISA budget cut at $135M, not Trump’s $495M appeared first on CyberScoop.
